# SI Units {#si_units}

Condenser vacuum gauge reads 715 mmHg when barometer stands at 757 mmHg. State the absolute pressure in kN/m2 and bar.

### **Given Data**

\begin{align*}
\text{Barometer reading (Atmospheric pressure)},\; P_{atm} &= 757\ \text{mmHg} \\
\text{Vacuum gauge reading},\; P_{vac} &= 715\ \text{mmHg}
\end{align*}

### **Absolute Pressure in mmHg**

$$
P_{abs} = P_{atm} - P_{vac}
$$

$$
P_{abs} = 757 - 715 = 42\ \text{mmHg}
$$

### **Convert mmHg → kN/m²**

$$
1 \text{ mmHg} = 133.322 \text{Pa} = 0.133322 \text{kN/m²}
$$

$$
P_{abs} = 42 \times 0.133322 = 5.6 \text{kN/m²}
$$

### **Convert kN/m² → bar**

$$
P\_{abs} = \frac{5.6}{100} = 0.056 \text{bar}
$$


### ✅ **Final Answers**

\[ \boxed{
\begin{aligned}
P_{abs} &= 42\ \text{mmHg} \\
P_{abs} &= 5.6\ \text{kN/m²} \\
P_{abs} &= 0.056\ \text{bar}
\end{aligned}
} \]

``` python
# Condenser Vacuum Problem

# Given data
P_atm_mmHg = 757   # Atmospheric pressure (mmHg)
P_vac_mmHg = 715   # Vacuum gauge reading (mmHg)

# Constants
MMHG_TO_KN_M2 = 0.133322   # 1 mmHg = 0.133322 kN/m²
KNM2_TO_BAR = 1 / 100      # 1 bar = 100 kN/m²

# Calculations
P_abs_mmHg = P_atm_mmHg - P_vac_mmHg          # Absolute pressure in mmHg
P_abs_kNm2 = P_abs_mmHg * MMHG_TO_KN_M2       # Convert to kN/m²
P_abs_bar = P_abs_kNm2 * KNM2_TO_BAR          # Convert to bar

# Results
print(f"Absolute Pressure = {P_abs_mmHg:.2f} mmHg")
print(f"Absolute Pressure = {P_abs_kNm2:.3f} kN/m²")
print(f"Absolute Pressure = {P_abs_bar:.4f} bar")
```
